original_title: Menendez brothers seek parole three decades after parents’ murders | Fox News
article_summary: Menendez brothers seek parole after sentence reduction: Erik and Lyle Menendez, convicted of murdering their parents in 1996, are set to appear before California's parole board this week. A judge reduced their sentences in May 2021, allowing them to be eligible for parole. The parole board will evaluate their rehabilitation efforts, prison conduct, remorse, and reintegration plans. If parole is granted, the governor has 120 days to review the decision.</s>
